discourse_list.title: Would it be a good idea to have a bug bounty for executive spells?

content.content: It could even be useful after an executive passes, because governance can cancel (make uncastable) an executive spell any time before it is cast, right? Perhaps this could draw a group of external actors to validate each executive and report if it doesn’t meet the stated specifications.
content.GPT-summary: The author is proposing the implementation of a bug bounty for executive spells, which would incentivize external actors to validate each executive and report if it doesn't meet the stated specifications. The author also suggests that this could be useful even after an executive passes, as governance can cancel it before it is cast. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: There has been some community talk about having an auditor group/individual who would be responsible for reviewing spells, and I think a bounty is a good idea. However, this work would be valuable (and should be compensated) even if no bugs were found
